intro: Bifaria ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf bifaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
